name: Uranium-236
description:
What's so different about maintaining an uncontrollable nuclear fission reaction? Controls:

- Mouse: click and hold to drag an energy field that deflects particles.

Goal:

- Generate as much energy as you can by keeping the reactor as hot as possible, for as long as possible.
- Neutrons will cause chain reactions with the core and increase the temperature.
- Antineutrinos will destroy neutrinos and cool down the core.
- The core also cools down over time.
- The game ends when the reactor freezes or blows up.

Uranium-236 was supposed to be a game about realistic nuclear fission and trying to handle the uncontrollable chain reactions, but the game went into a bit different direction. And yeah, I ran out of time and I know that the math is terrible for how the generator works. :smile:

Enjoy the game!
